item.source: Why doesn't this code give me an error, but still not work?

item.title: Why doesn't this code give me an error, but still not work?
item.dc:creator: @Owner-Fugh Owner-Fugh
item.description:
@Owner-Fugh wrote:

I have no clue about the NPC not talking, but maybe you don’t have the right kind of java for the Compiler or the right KIND of Compiler.

Try and use mine, hopefully it will work. (Works fine for all my updates)

Here:

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

Read full topic
item.source: Why doesn't this code give me an error, but still not work?

item.title: Why doesn't this code give me an error, but still not work?
item.dc:creator: @Xile_Maizez Xile Maizez
item.description:
@Xile_Maizez wrote:

I’ve been tyring to get an NPC to say if im Online or Offline, but I’ve tried like 5 or 6 different codes and none seem to be working.
I’ve tried searching but they still don’t work.

Im running on v0id-pkz source.

Here is the code on my NPCHandler.java:

if (npcs[i].npcType == 286) { if (misc.random(10) < 4) { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; if (PlayerHandler.isPlayerOn("Xile 0wner")) { npcs[i].textUpdate = "The Owner, Xile 0wner is Online!"; } else { npcs[i].textUpdate = "The Owner, Xile 0wner is Offline! =("; } } }

I get no Compiler Errors.
I have the right autospawn, im looking right at the guy, and he just doesn’t talk!

Can anyone please help me?
I really need this code to work.
Thanks.

Read full topic
item.source: Why doesn't this code give me an error, but still not work?
